title: Executive Order 11620-The Honorable Hugo L. Black
content: As a mark of respect to the memory of the Honorable Hugo L. Black, former Associate Justice of the United States, it is hereby ordered, pursuant to the provisions of Section 4 of Proclamation 3044 of March 1, 1954, as amended, that until interment the flag of the United States shall be flown at half-staff on all buildings, grounds and naval vessels of the Federal Government in the District of Columbia and throughout the United States and its Territories and possessions. I also direct that the flag shall be flown at half-staff for the same length of time at all United States embassies, legations, consular offices, and other facilities abroad, including all military facilities and naval vessels and stations.
citation: Richard Nixon, Executive Order 11620-The Honorable Hugo L. Black Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/307164
